author: cms-sw
body:
- Using separate test directory is not optional any more. Each tests should run in its own sub-directory.
- Running `unittests/runtests` without `-v` option is not going to dump the unit tests output on stdout/stderr. Without `-v`  build rules are going generate output like [a]. Behaviour with `-v` remains same i.e. you will see the output of each test on terminal along with these new extra `Pass|Fail` lines

[a]
```
Pass 4s    ... testA
Pass 2s    ... testB
Fail 1s    ... testC
Pass 1s    ... testD
```
title: [BuildRules] More updates for unit tests
